description: Obama became the first black president of the U.S.A. His presidency lasted 2 periods, totaling a period of 8 years, starting in 2009 and ending in 2017, being superceded by Donald Trump.
Obama worked as an American Senator acting on Illinois' behalf, from 2005 to 2008.
Obama was a member of Illinois Senate in the 13th District from 1997 to 2004.
Obama attended Harvard Law School from 1988 to 1991, where he studied law.
Obama attended Columbia College from 1981 to 1983.
Obama attended Punahou School from 5th to 12th grade during the years 1971 to 1979. Punahou School is a private college prep school located in Honolulu, Hawaii.
